name: FiniteStates
description:
Solve simple puzzles using different models of computation - almost like programming with them. Built with JavaScript and the HTML canvas. The project is open source and can be viewed here: https://github.com/shailpatels/FiniteStates.

Anonymous stats on how each level is solved gets saved and uploaded to my personal server, this includes things like the number of levels completed, how many states and transitions used, how many tries a level took, etc. If you prefer not to have anything sent you can turn of your internet after the page has loaded and the rest of the game should work fine. The data is completely anonymous and can not be used to track you, it will be used to later create a scoreboard for solutions for each level and for my undergraduate thesis which will be about learning and video games.

Press the 'help' button on-screen for a list of instructions and other tips about the different models of computation.
